review_text: The House on Moffet is a real gem. The photos don't do it justice. Wonderful, relaxing, cozy, welcoming, comfortable, well-equipped, and a nice eclectic mix of vintage design. Our host David was highly responsive and well-organized. We loved sitting on the porch listening to crickets and frogs at night and watching thunderstorms roll through, as well as cooking family dinners to share at the formal dining table, and relaxing in one of the two living rooms, reading a book and listening to some records (BYO vinyl). The neighborhood is excellent - perfect for morning or evening walks among some of the oldest historic houses in Joplin, and a park right across the street makes it ideal for travelling with kids. If you're around on a Saturday, make sure to hit up Empire Market a few miles away for fresh local produce, meat, and baked goods. The nearby Bruncheonette on Main St is also not to be missed, and only a lovely 15 min walk away. We eagerly await our next opportunity to visit!
